intro: Dichelostemma volubile, commonly known as the purple grass or blue-eyed grass, is a member of the Iridaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States, particularly California. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, purple, or white. Its flowering period typically occurs in late spring to early summer. Dichelostemma volubile is often found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodlands.
